item.title: Mutants Among Us: the unexpected effects of a mutation in AMPD1
item.description: Introduction Recently I’ve become interested in the effects of a particular mutation. The mutation is a single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) in a protein called Adenosine Monophosphate Deaminase 1 (AMPD1). In this case, the nucleotide base at this position was supposed to be a “C” (cytosine), but it’s been changed to a “T” (thymine). This single letter mutation has been called “the most prevalent genetic disease mutation”, at least in Caucasians1.
